entities: Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE)
summary:
The Security Council deplores the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 on 17 July in Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine, resulting in 298 deaths. It reaffirms international law prohibiting acts of violence threatening civil aviation safety and stresses the need for a full, thorough, and independent international investigation. 

The Council condemns the downing of MH17 and expresses deepest sympathies to the victims' families and countries of origin. It supports efforts for an international investigation, recognizes Ukraine's efforts with ICAO and other experts, and calls on states to provide assistance.

The Council expresses grave concern at limited access to the crash site, demands armed groups refrain from compromising the site's integrity, and provide safe and unrestricted access. It demands ceased military activities in the area, dignified treatment and recovery of victims' bodies, and cooperation from all states and actors.

The Council demands accountability for those responsible, urges parties to observe international rules on civil aviation safety, and welcomes UN cooperation in the investigation. The Secretary-General is requested to identify options for UN support and report to the Security Council. The Council decides to remain seized of the matter.
